### printInst() {#ad8b1b771eb418dde21dc5f500a78b3d1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void NVPTXInstPrinter::printInst (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &#42; MI, uint64&#95;t Address, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Annot, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsubtargetinfo">MCSubtargetInfo</a> &amp; STI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Print the specified <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> to the specified <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a>.

<code>Address</code> the address of current instruction on most targets, used to print a PC relative immediate as the target address. On targets where a PC relative immediate is relative to the next instruction and the length of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> is difficult to measure (e.g. x86), this is the address of the next instruction. If Address is 0, the immediate will be printed.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/lib/target/nvptx/mctargetdesc/nvptxinstprinter-h/#l00028">28</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/lib/target/nvptx/mctargetdesc/nvptxinstprinter-h">NVPTXInstPrinter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/lib/target/nvptx/mctargetdesc/nvptxinstprinter-cpp/#l00074">74</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/lib/target/nvptx/mctargetdesc/nvptxinstprinter-cpp">NVPTXInstPrinter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### printOperand() {#aee685621f62068066a69335b0d3c0e20}
